intro: Tovomita aequatoriensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian tovomita, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, lowland areas and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
